remarks: If a class is a subclass of another class, then its power class is a subclass of that other class's power class.  Left-to-right implication of Exercise 18 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. ~ sspwimp , using conventional notation, was translated from virtual deduction form, ~ sspwimpVD , using a translation program.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 23-Apr-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement: sspwimp $p |- ( A C_ B -> ~P A C_ ~P B ) $.
